issue.title: [C++] Consider using #pragma once instead of include guards
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-3071](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3071). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
I think this is supported on all the compilers we support since we are C++11-only. This would ease maintenance and refactoring

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-3071?focusedCommentId=16761800) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
I am recommending in code reviews to use `#pragma once` in new header files. We can go about replacing existing guards on an ad hoc basis
